Description: Textile fragment of mummy bandage; one end of a torn strip of linen, medium quality, undyed, colour now buff to tan to grey-brown (oily stains ?). Remains of a plain warp fringe, neither twisted nor grouped, across one end. Other end cut, and sides torn. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.24 ends per 10mm and weft c.11 picks per 10mm.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville
Acquisition notes: Wrapped, together with EA 75993-75995, in paper labelled in 19th century hand, 'Mummy Clothes various (No. 2)' and in pencil, 'Granville'. Probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by A B Granville in 1821.
